Summarize following article:

 (CNN) I see signs of revolution everywhere. see in op-ed pages of newspapers, on state ballots in nearly half the country. see it in politicians who once preferred to play it safe with this explosive issue but now willing to stake political futures on it. see revolution in eyes of sterling scientists, previously reluctant to dip toe into heavily stigmatized world, diving in head first. in new surgeon general who cites data showing how helpful it can be. see revolution in attitudes of everyday Americans. For first time majority, 53%, favor legalization, 77% supporting it for medical purposes. Support for legalization risen 11 points in past few years. In 1969, first time Pew asked question about legalization, only 12% of nation was in favor. see revolution burning white hot among young people, also shows up among parents and grandparents in my kids' school. police officer met in Michigan part of revolution, as are editors of medical journal, Neurosurgery. see it in faces of good parents, uprooting lives to get medicine for children -- in children themselves, such as Charlotte, went from having 300 seizures a week to one or two a month. won't consistently dramatic results (or impact) in others, but what medicine does? see medical marijuana revolution in surprising places. Girl's seizures spur medical marijuana legislation in Georgia . Among my colleagues, patients friends. seen revolution in my own family. few years ago, I told my mother I was investigating topic for documentary, was met with long pause. "Marijuana...?" She whispered in half questioning, half disapproving tone. She could barely say word her response filled me with self-doubt. Even as grown man, mom can still make my cheeks turn red shatter my confidence with a single word.last week she stopped mid-conversation said, "I proud of you on marijuana thing." I waited for other shoe to drop, but it didn't. she added, "You probably helped people suffering." I don't think we had ever had a conversation like that one. moment, I saw a revolution can bring you to tears. word revolution, comes from Latin revolutio, to "turn around." I had my own turn around years ago, it was a lonely place to hold supportive position on medical marijuana. Hardly government officials agree to be interviewed on topic. Even patients I spoke to were reluctant to share stories. tricky learned, to be on right side of science but on wrong side of ideology. When we put first "Weed" documentary on television in August 2013, didn't know if anyone would watch our yearlong investigation. worse didn't know if they would care. Is weed legal in your state? two years later, in "Weed 3," we are eyewitnesses to a revolution in full swing. You will ride along with us for dawn of first federally approved clinical study on use ... number of accidental painkiller overdoses, greatest cause of preventable death in country. I sat across from Sens. Kirsten Gillibrand (D-New York) and Cory Booker (D-New Jersey), knew something extraordinary was happening. They were reciting story of Charlotte Figi and countless other children. quoting back data from earlier investigations. extolling potential virtues of the plant, before the interview started. There impatience about them, they seemed in hurry to make a large dent in marijuana reform. They want marijuana to be rescheduled. They want it now. want doctors to prescribe it at VA hospitals country. They want it now. want research dollars freed up to study the plant. They want it now.They want fellow lawmakers at state and national level to acknowledge what most world, including citizens the United States, have known for long time: Marijuana is a medicine, should be studied treated like any other medicine. they want all it now. I spent much interview challenging them. needed to remind them people, long before me or them, been trying to do many these same things for 40 years, been rejected every time. reminded them politicians have hard time winning elections on issue of marijuana but less difficulty losing them. I challenged them every step way. "This time will be different," Booker confidently told me walked out room. Is marijuana as safe as -- or safer than -- alcohol? I know how easy it is do nothing because I did nothing for too long. Take a look at data, educate yourself talk to patients, often out of options find hope in form of simple plant. Journalists shouldn't take a position. It makes sense. Objectivity is king. But at open questions get answered. contentious issues get resolved. common sense prevails. here: We should legalize medical marijuana. should do it nationally. should do it now. 9 things to know about legal pot .

Summarize article:

 He looks barely teenage. child amassed thousands of Twitter followers with pictorial updates of 'gang life'. baby-faced boy from Memphis, Tennessee, poses with guns, cash, bags of marijuana. Scroll down for video . Baby-faced: little boy amassed more than 3,000 followers on Twitter with pictures like these . In many pictures he smoking suspicious substances with captions 'High Life' Backlash: boy, from Memphis, prompted critics calling his stunts 'sad' In one video he laughs points gun at camera in apparent attempt to look menacing - adults laugh in background. In others pictured blowing smoke with caption: 'High Life'. Tweets include phrases, 'I need a bad b****', 'f*** da police', 'gang sh** n****'. Some feature sexual references, 'quit suckin my d***'. As he a minor, DailyMail.com will not identify little boy. child's tweets prompted backlash from other Twitter users members community. One woman tweeted him: 'you need help i feel bad for you parents should be ashamed please get help education sad and disappointing.' Another Twitter user said: 'You poor baby. stop it & go to school.' Adults around: Many his pictures and videos taken with adults seen laughing, unfazed . Guns: little boy, appears to barely teenage, regularly poses for followers with guns . boy hit back at critics claiming had tough year backlash 'stressing out' his mother . Orrden Williams, Memphis resident victim of gang violence, told AOL.com: 'What he's doing on here is something he's going to bring upon society one day. It's inevitable.' added: 'All it takes is right influence, this can change.'s a wake-up Memphis call there.Hitting back at critics boy tweeted Friday: 'Wish some people mind own business' 'it's stressing my mama out'. He adds his sister 'been locked up for two years' critics 'don't know half of what we been through end of 2014 & beg of 2015.' Authorities cognizant of Twitter perpetuating gang culture. many like this young boy use it forum to flaunt drugs and guns, around 50 per cent of organized gangs maintain in United States maintain social media profile.

Summarize article:

 New Jersey Governor Chris Christie wasn't looking presidential Tuesday night when into heated debate with a veteran teacher at town hall meeting. now state's largest teacher's union calling him out for his 'bullying' behavior. 'He's always taken nasty disrespectful tone with teachers individuals question him at events,' Steve Wollmer of NJ Education Association told NJ.com. 'It's one thing never to change.' Scroll Down for Video . Not nice: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie (left) called a bully for interacted with a teacher (Kathy Mooney, right) at Tuesday night town hall meeting. sentiment doesn't ring well with Christie's ambitions to run in Republican presidential primaries next year. Tuesday night Christie appeared at Kenilworth Town Hall to take questions from citizens, when Kathy Mooney, a high school English Teacher from Roselle Park, took microphone. Mooney, teacher for 27 years, questioned Christie's motivations behind a legal settlement with oil company ExxonMobil could have contributed to state's pension plans for teachers. Christie settled deal for $225million, despite state originally asked for $8.9billion Mooney described as 'favoring the affluent' 'kicking state workers under the bus'. 'I you could have gotten more money on dollar,' Mooney said. 'Do?' defensive Christie responded. 'You know that???' Mooney started to respond not before cut off by governor. good deal? Mooney questioned Christie's decision-making behind $225million legal settlement. state originally wanted $8.9billion from oil company, Mooney says would have had huge impact on pensions for public employees . 'I Do you know that?' Christie continued. 'I wanna know how you know that.you're a teacher standing in front of students day conveying facts - things they need to learn. I to understand your analysis of know in a ten year long court case you have enough detail to know.' Mooney explains she read about deal in newspaper did not attend meeting 'to be bullied'. 'You're not being bullied, because you're asking me a question, I'm going to ask you questions back,' Christie says he continues to dodge the issue. 'He said, "I'm not bullying you' as he bullied her,"' Wollmer said of exchange. reason Wollmer and his union responded sharply to Christie's town hall meeting Tuesday night he blamed the union for their role in current pension system 'The your union, over time asked for higher benefits - more expensive benefits - union knew state could not afford,' Christie said Tuesday.

Summarize article:

 YouTube star Cassey Ho hit back at critics with a powerful provocative new video, highlighting cruel comments left by viewers of her fitness-focused clips who accuse trim toned online icon of being from ‘too fat’ to ‘ugly’ to ‘pudgy’. Cassey's YouTube channel, Blogilates, has over two million subscribers, fans may surprised to learn negative comments left under California resident’s fitness videos still get under her skin – greater impact on her than positive messages sent by fans. But though mean critical messages may dent in 28-year-old’s self-esteem, workout pro getting last word with her latest video, The 'Perfect' Body, examines whether conforming to society's standards is key to happiness, while highlighting cruel comments she received from viewers YouTube videos. Scroll down for video. Fighting back: In her new video, Pilates instructor and YouTube star Cassey Ho combats body-shamers who comment on her videos. She's only human: full of confidence, Cassey said felt bad about herself after reading nasty comments calling her 'fat' online. In post on Blogilates blog Cassey said negative comments on her videos are nothing new, but flood of nastiness grown especially bad lately. She added trash-talking brought her to tears on. 'It’s hard to be content with shape of body when people constantly telling you how fat you are, how much weight you need to lose weight need to gain,' she wrote. 'What do people want?' Cassey to through her new video, fans can see what it's like to face negativity, watch as her own self-esteem gets 'stripped away', leaving her feeling insecure and ashamed about her appearance.Fit or fat: slim toned blogger says negativity in comments section her YouTube channel become nasty lately, made her cry . Peanut gallery problems: In new video, Cassey picks at her body, honing in on places commenters say she could improve. video begins with Cassey posting a selfie in gym clothes, taken after workout. She starts to read comments, they start off positive, soon people telling her she shouldn't give fitness advice because she is fat. Cassey to strip down to underwear, examining pinching prodding her body, using spiteful comments to direct her to different parts her physique people insist need changing. video she grows more unsatisfied with as negative comments pop up. YouTube star gets to work, manipulating her body in simulation of real-life Photoshop. She thins her thighs, hips waist, makes butt and chest bigger changes color of her eyes., she posts another selfie of 'improved' look - achieved with help a body double - but clearly still unhappy, uses feeling to show viewers giving in to body-shaming will only leave you worse off. Before and after: fitness expert's body goes under major transformation; Cassey used a body double to achieve final look . Moral message: Even after making her butt chest bigger waist and legs smaller, Cassey still doesn't find happiness at end of video . No Photoshop here: retouching in Cassey's video was meant to prove a point - she doesn't use Photoshop in photos posts online . her 'take that' attitude left detractors speechless. Readers of her blog flooded comments section latest post with overwhelmingly positive feedback. 'Thank you for standing up to this struggle for girls and women everywhere,' wrote one fan. Another chimed in: 'I applaud you your natural, beautiful self. you’re a wonderful inspiration for young people.' Cassey hopes viewers relate to video's message share it effort to battle body shaming cyber bullying.

Summarize article:

 British taekwondo fighter Aaron Cook confirmed plans to compete for Moldova at 2016 Olympics in Rio. Dorset-born Cook, 24, overlooked for Great Britain taekwondo squad at London 2012, applied for citizenship after funding from Moldovan billionaire Igor Iuzefovici now received passport from small eastern European state. 'I will soon begin new journey representing Republic of Moldova at International competitions hopefully Rio Olympic games and beyond should qualify,' Cook wrote on Facebook page. Three time European champion Aaron Cook (right) refused to fight for Great Britain since May 2012 . British taekwondo star granted citizenship by Moldova plans to fight for them in Rio 2016 . 'Although upset and disappointed not represent my country of birth at another major championships, felt no other option. 'I am a fighter at heart not going to throw away 20 years of dedication because of bureaucracy.' Cook fought for Team GB at Beijing 2008, felt overlooked for London 2012 - when Lutalo Muhammad selected won bronze - because decided to quit British programme in 2011. Cook aggrieved at being overlooked in favour of Lutalo Muhammad, won bronze at London 2012 . GB Taekwondo denied this but Cook refused to compete under British flag since May 2012 fought for Isle of Man since early 2013. amazing couple of years full of memories would have loved to continue competing under Isle of Man banner,' Cook said. 'Unfortunately never possible made clear to in May last year after winning European Championships for third consecutive time not possible for to be selected for Team GB, regardless of world ranking or performances. Cook competes against Mauro Sarmiento at Olympic Games in Beijing in 2008 'Having received no funding or support from GB system financing myself since June 2011, not a situation acceptable to me did not want to put myself, family, friends, supporters or sport through same situation we forced to endure at London 2012 Olympic Games' Cook hopes to represent Moldova for first time at inaugural Baku European Games in June served mandatory three-year period since representing previous country., British Olympic Association could block move Sportsmail understands it still in talks over matter.

Summarize article:

 As countdown continues to Floyd Mayweather's mega-fight with Manny Pacquiao in Las Vegas on May 2, Money Man's daughter Iyanna Mayweather shared thoughts about life in training with her champion father. Mayweather vs Pacquiao will generate revenue upwards of $300 million in most lucrative bout in boxing history ahead of May showdown, Iyanna Mayweather offered insight into her dad's intense training regime. 'When watch my dad train's inspiring to,' she said. Iyanna Mayweather spending time in father Floyd's training camp . Iyanna watches as champion dad gets through another gruelling training session . Iyanna amazed by dad's work ethic in gym and amazed his jump rump skills . 'To work at hard not working out work hard at everything. dad fighting Pacquiao... it's just another fight in.' Floyd Mayweather and Pacquiao keeping boxing fans updated daily on social media with training schedules Iyanna Mayweather explained impressed with father's work ethic in gym. 'I like watching dad jump rope never seen anyone jump rope like before,' added. Mayweather posted update to Instagram account on Friday embarked on another shopping trip . 'It fun coming to gym when dad's not in training camp, Money team doesn't see each other often when dad gets back in training camp, we get back to seeing each other. 'We hang out a lot play around have fun outside of gym. My dad is my best friend.'

Summarize article:

 Arsene Wenger admits concerned Theo Walcott’s confidence plummeting after struggles with England this week. Arsenal manager will have heart-to-heart chat with forward ahead of Saturday’s crunch top-four clash against Liverpool. Walcott hauled off after 55 minutes of England’s 1-1 draw in Italy on Tuesday night. Theo Walcott struggled for England Arsene Wenger admits concerned by winger's confidence . Walcott replaced by Ross Barkley after 55 minutes of England's 1-1 draw against Italy on Tuesday. 2 - Premier League goals for Walcott this season - average haul per season during at Arsenal is 5.6. latest disappointment in difficult season for 26-year-old, struggled for game time since returning from long-term lay-off due to serious knee injury. With Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain out of Liverpool’s visit due to hamstring strain, Danny Welbeck major doubt after knee problem on international duty, Walcott could start on Saturday. Wenger said: ‘Yes worried about Theo’s confidence. He’s sensitive concerned about damage game can have on his mind. Walcott could face Liverpool on Saturday with Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain injured Danny Welbeck a doubt. ‘He’s not completely there yet (after injury). exposed like, people have harsh judgement on him not deserved because he does well. ‘At he frustrated, but that is normal. I will speak with him, but think he strong enough. ‘I will see what state of mind he in. We always word if positive experience or negative experience, ask “how did it go?”. always speak about last game. ‘He not fragile mentally, strong mentally but disappointed because when come back from injury always think you ready. ‘He needs patience. moment not in his best mood.‘He has big confidence in himself gone through difficult periods life always come out with strength.’ Arsenal boss Wenger says he will speak with Walcott believes Gunners winger is 'strong enough' Walcott found himself playing in No 10 role for England in Turin — role he not accustomed to. Wenger admitted surprised to see pacy forward in unfamiliar position. ‘Have ever seen him play No 10 in training? No,’ said Wenger. ‘Theo’s strength is quality of his movements he wants to go to get on end of things. not a guy who provides. don’t think intention of Roy Hodgson to play him there. maybe because Wayne Rooney took initiative during game to play higher up tell Theo to drop back. didn’t see Roy Hodgson in game stand up to say “Walcott, you come play in midfield and Rooney you go up front”. That’s initiative they took on pitch.’ Walcott aims a shot at goal during England's friendly against Italy at Juventus Stadium in Turin . Walcott was starting his first international game in 18 months having injured cruciate ligaments., Wenger insists fundamental flaws in FA chairman Greg Dyke’s proposal to increase number of required homegrown players in Premier League squads to 12. Dyke believes increasing number of British players in squads will help contribute to more successful England team. But Wenger said: ‘I believe we are in top level competition you earn your right through quality of performance rather than place of birth. happy to like to contribute to quality of English national team, but two questions before. between 1966 and 1996 no foreign players in England it didn’t improve much performances of national team., if between ages of 16 and 21 England youth teams win every competition in Europe something we have to do because they not getting their chance at top level.Wenger believes flaws in FA Chairman Greg Dyke’s proposal to increase homegrown quota. ‘That not the case, on contrary. between 16 and 21 English youth teams, until now, not performed. that’s the heart of the problem. ‘Let’s get better at that level, then if problem integrating these players in top teams, to do something about it. ‘I today to be brave to integrate young players in top teams because pressure is high. still believe when they are good enough, they play. ‘You speak about Raheem Sterling and Harry Kane. Nobody stops quality, no matter where they from. focus on that first.’
